intro: Pterygodium mundii, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has compound leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds. Pterygodium mundii is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
